group9_package.subpkg_1 package¶

Submodules¶

group9_package.subpkg_1.core_functions_module_extract module¶

This python module provides functionality for querying and extracting astronomical data from the SDSS database.

class group9_package.subpkg_1.core_functions_module_extract.MetaDataExtractor(query, data=None)¶

Bases: SpectralAnalysisBase

A Class for extracting user requested metadata

extract_chemical_abundances()¶

Extracts chemical abundances from the data.

Returns:

A table containing the ‘bestObjID’ and ‘elodieFeH’ columns.

Return type:

Astropy Table

Raises:

ValueError – If no data is available to extract chemical abundances or the required columns are missing.

extract_coordinates()¶

Extracts astronomical coordinates from the data.

Returns:

A table containing the ‘bestObjID’, ‘ra’, and ‘dec’ columns.

Return type:

Astropy Table

Raises:

ValueError – If no data is available to extract coordinates or the required columns are missing.

extract_identifiers()¶

Extracts unique identifiers from the data.

Returns:

A column of identifiers from the data.

Return type:

Astropy Table Column

Raises:

ValueError – If no data is available to extract identifiers or the ‘bestObjID’ column is missing.

extract_redshifts()¶

Extracts redshift values from the data.

Returns:

A table containing the ‘bestObjID’ and ‘elodieZ’ columns.

Return type:

Astropy Table

Raises:

ValueError – If no data is available to extract redshifts or the required columns are missing.

class group9_package.subpkg_1.core_functions_module_extract.SpectraExtract(data_row)¶

Bases: SpectralAnalysisBase

A Class for extracting spectral data for individual astronomical objects

extract_spectra()¶

Retrieves spectral data for the astronomical object represented by inputted data row.

Returns:

A Pandas DataFrame containing the spectral data.

Return type:

DataFrame

extract_spectra_full()¶

Retrieves full spectral data in FITS format and processes it.

Returns:

A Pandas DataFrame containing the processed spectral data.

Return type:

DataFrame

class group9_package.subpkg_1.core_functions_module_extract.SpectralAnalysisBase(query, data=None)¶

Bases: object

Foundational class for performing spectral analysis by querying and handling data from the SDSS database.

execute_query()¶

Executes the SQL query against the SDSS database and stores the result in the data attribute.

Raises:

RemoteServiceError, TimeoutError, ValueError, RequestException – For various errors that may occur during query execution.

static query_validation(query: str)¶

Validates the given query string to ensure it contains basic elements of a SQL query.

Parameters:

query (str) – The query string to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the query string does not contain necessary SQL elements.

group9_package.subpkg_1.core_functions_module_modify module¶

This python module extends the functionality of the core_functions_module_extract by focusing on data preprocessing and modification techniques of spectral data.

class group9_package.subpkg_1.core_functions_module_modify.DataPreprocessor(query, data=None)¶

Bases: SpectralAnalysisBase

A Class for preprocessing spectral data including normalization, outlier removal, interpolation, and redshift correction.

correct_redshift(bands=['u', 'g', 'r', 'i'])¶

Corrects the wavelengths of spectral data for redshift.

Parameters:

bands (list of str, optional) – List of bands to apply redshift correction. Defaults to [‘u’, ‘g’, ‘r’, ‘i’].

Raises:

ValueError – If there is no wavelength data available for redshift correction.

interpolate_data(new_wavelengths)¶

Interpolates the spectral data to new wavelengths.

Parameters:

new_wavelengths (list or array) – The new wavelengths for interpolation.

Raises:

ValueError – If there is insufficient data for interpolation or if the lengths of new and old wavelengths do not match.

normalize_data()¶

Normalizes the spectral data using Z-score normalization.

Raises:

ValueError – If there is no data available for normalization.

remove_outliers(threshold=2.5)¶

Removes outliers from the spectral data based on a Z-score threshold.

Parameters:

threshold (float, optional) – The Z-score threshold for identifying outliers. Defaults to 2.5.

Raises:

ValueError – If there is no data available for outlier removal.

class group9_package.subpkg_1.core_functions_module_modify.WavelengthAlignment¶

Bases: object

WavelengthAlign(target_range)¶

Aligns spectra data to a specified wavelength range, potentially requiring interpolation.

Parameters:

  • spectra_data (DataFrame) – DataFrame containing FULL spectra data. It should have columns: ‘loglam’, ‘flux’, ‘ivar’, ‘and_mask’, ‘or_mask’, ‘wdisp’, ‘sky’, ‘model’.

  • target_range (tuple) – A tuple specifying the target wavelength range (start, end).

Returns:

DataFrame containing aligned spectra data.

Return type:

DataFrame

group9_package.subpkg_1.data_augmentation_module module¶

class group9_package.subpkg_1.data_augmentation_module.DataAugmentation(data)¶

Bases: object

A Class for Augmenting Preprocessed Spectral data with derivatives and fractional derivatives

augment_both_derivatives(column_name, derivative_order)¶

Computes the Regular and Fractional Derivative of a column for spectral data and creates a column with the derivative data

Parameters:

  • data (Pandas Data Frame) – spectral data to compute derivatives on

  • column_name – the name of the column to compite the derivative on

  • derivative_order – the order of the derivative to take

compute_derivative(column_name)¶

Computes the Derivative of a column for spectral data and creates a column with the derivative data

Parameters:

  • data (Pandas Data Frame) – spectral data to compute derivatives on

  • column_name – the name of the column to compite the derivative on

Raises:

ValueError – If the given column is not a column in the data

compute_fractional_derivative(column_name, derivative_order)¶

Computes the Fractional Derivative of a column for spectral data and creates a column with the derivative data

Parameters:

  • data (Pandas Data Frame) – spectral data to compute derivatives on

  • column_name – the name of the column to compite the derivative on

  • derivative_order – the order of the derivative to take

Raises:

ValueError – If the given column is not a column in the data

group9_package.subpkg_1.visualize_module module¶

Module for visualizing spectral data, providing tools to graphically represent spectra extracted from astronomical observations.

class group9_package.subpkg_1.visualize_module.SpectralVisualizer(*, row=None, data=None)¶

Bases: object

Class for visualizing spectral data either from a provided data frame or by extracting spectral data given a row of astronomical data.

visualize()¶

Visualizes the spectral data by plotting the flux against the wavelength.

Raises:

ValueError – If both ‘data’ and ‘row’ are None or empty, indicating there is no valid data to visualize.
